meanings.definition: A person who performs menial tasks or runs errands for someone else, often in a military context.
meanings.sent1: The dogrobber delivered messages to the soldiers.
meanings.sent2: The army officer assigned the dogrobber to clean the barracks.
meanings.sent3: The dogrobber accidentally mixed up the orders and chaos ensued.
meanings.sent4: In the military hierarchy, he was considered the lowest rank, a mere dogrobber.
meanings.sent5: The image of the tired dogrobber carrying heavy supplies stuck in his mind.

meanings.definition: To act as a servant or lackey, especially in a subservient or demeaning manner.
meanings.sent1: He had to dogrobber for his boss all day long.
meanings.sent2: She refused to dogrobber for anyone who treated her disrespectfully.
meanings.sent3: The cat meowed at him as if ordering him to dogrobber around.
meanings.sent4: The politician was accused of dogrobbering for the wealthy elite.
meanings.sent5: The idea of having to dogrobber for his rude neighbor made him cringe.
